repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
## Summary

- When `:source` is given a range in a file like vimdoc, use treesitter to detect if the selected text is inside a Lua codeblock (injection)
- If the range is in a Lua injection, execute as Lua instead of Vimscript
- Falls back to current behavior when no treesitter parser is available

This allows sourcing Lua code from help files without explicitly using `:'<,'>lua`.

## Test plan

- [x] Added tests for Lua codeblock detection in vimdoc
- [x] Added tests for Vimscript codeblock (non-Lua injection)
- [x] Added tests for fallback when no treesitter parser
- [x] All existing `:source` tests pass

Closes #36761

comment_data.body: Should only parse the specified range here, `parse(true)` can be very expensive
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1316,6 +1316,25 @@ function vim.deprecate(name, alternative, version, plugin, backtrace)
   end
 end
 
+--- Check if a range in a buffer is inside a Lua codeblock via treesitter injection.
+--- Used by :source to detect Lua code in non-Lua files (e.g., vimdoc).
+--- @param bufnr integer Buffer number
+--- @param line1 integer Start line (1-indexed)
+--- @param line2 integer End line (1-indexed)
+--- @return boolean True if the range is in a Lua injection
+function vim._source_is_lua(bufnr, line1, line2)
+  local ok, parser = pcall(vim.treesitter.get_parser, bufnr)
+  if not ok or not parser then
+    return false
+  end
+  -- Parse to ensure injections are processed
+  parser:parse(true)

comment_data.body: Can this line be removed if we just do `insert([[*test.txt* ...`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -296,6 +296,46 @@ describe(':source', function()
     eq(nil, result:find('E484'))
     os.remove(test_file)
   end)
+
+  describe('treesitter Lua codeblock detection', function()
+    it('sources Lua codeblock in vimdoc file', function()
+      insert([[
+        *test.txt*  Test help file
+
+        Example: >lua
+          vim.g.test_vimdoc_lua = 42
+        <]])
+      feed('dd') -- remove trailing empty line from insert

comment_data.body: Using Lua for core code is the right instinct, but let's put this in `runtime/lua/vim/_core/util.lua` . (After https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36870 , code in `_core/` will be available with `nvim -u NONE` )
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1316,6 +1316,25 @@ function vim.deprecate(name, alternative, version, plugin, backtrace)
   end
 end
 
+--- Check if a range in a buffer is inside a Lua codeblock via treesitter injection.
+--- Used by :source to detect Lua code in non-Lua files (e.g., vimdoc).
+--- @param bufnr integer Buffer number
+--- @param line1 integer Start line (1-indexed)
+--- @param line2 integer End line (1-indexed)
+--- @return boolean True if the range is in a Lua injection
+function vim._source_is_lua(bufnr, line1, line2)

comment_data.body: this can be added to the above test, then just move the cursor. that also makes the test closer to real-world. and the `setlocal filetype=` test can be done here. so then instead of a `describe()` just one `it()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -296,6 +296,46 @@ describe(':source', function()
     eq(nil, result:find('E484'))
     os.remove(test_file)
   end)
+
+  describe('treesitter Lua codeblock detection', function()
+    it('sources Lua codeblock in vimdoc file', function()
+      insert([[
+        *test.txt*  Test help file
+
+        Example: >lua
+          vim.g.test_vimdoc_lua = 42
+        <]])
+      feed('dd') -- remove trailing empty line from insert
+      command('setlocal filetype=help')
+      -- Select the Lua code line (line 4) and source it
+      feed('4GV')
+      feed_command(':source')
+      eq(42, eval('g:test_vimdoc_lua'))
+    end)
+
+    it('sources Vimscript when not in a Lua codeblock', function()
+      insert([[
+        *test.txt*  Test help file
+
+        Example: >vim
+          let g:test_vimdoc_vim = 99
+        <]])

comment_data.body: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36870 was merged so this can live in `_core/util.lua`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1316,6 +1316,25 @@ function vim.deprecate(name, alternative, version, plugin, backtrace)
   end
 end
 
+--- Check if a range in a buffer is inside a Lua codeblock via treesitter injection.
+--- Used by :source to detect Lua code in non-Lua files (e.g., vimdoc).
+--- @param bufnr integer Buffer number
+--- @param line1 integer Start line (1-indexed)
+--- @param line2 integer End line (1-indexed)
+--- @return boolean True if the range is in a Lua injection
+function vim._source_is_lua(bufnr, line1, line2)

@@ -296,6 +296,46 @@ describe(':source', function()
     eq(nil, result:find('E484'))
     os.remove(test_file)
   end)
+
+  describe('treesitter Lua codeblock detection', function()
+    it('sources Lua codeblock in vimdoc file', function()
+      insert([[
+        *test.txt*  Test help file
+
+        Example: >lua

+        <]])
+      feed('dd') -- remove trailing empty line from insert
+      command('setlocal filetype=help')
+      -- Select the Lua code line (line 4) and source it
+      feed('4GV')
+      feed_command(':source')

comment_data.body: Just for future reference: We can start adding topic-specific files in `_core/` easily. Meanwhile, `_core/util.lua` is only for stuff that doesn't have a home yet. But this function could obviously live in something like `_core/treesitter.lua`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,4 +41,22 @@ function M.read_chunk(file, size)
   return tostring(chunk)
 end
 
+--- Check if a range in a buffer is inside a Lua codeblock via treesitter injection.
+--- Used by :source to detect Lua code in non-Lua files (e.g., vimdoc).
+--- @param bufnr integer Buffer number
+--- @param line1 integer Start line (1-indexed)
+--- @param line2 integer End line (1-indexed)
+--- @return boolean True if the range is in a Lua injection
+function M.source_is_lua(bufnr, line1, line2)

comment_regular_data.body: @brianhuster Apologies for not catching this. May I just open a new PR for update of the docs, or do I need to first open an Issue?

title: feat(source): detect Lua codeblocks via treesitter injection
